pli-tv-pvr5:1.1: What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning disputes,
pli-tv-pvr5:1.3: how many are the causal occasions,
pli-tv-pvr5:1.8: by how many modes does one dispute,
pli-tv-pvr5:1.9: by how many decidings is a legal question concerning disputes stopped?
pli-tv-pvr5:2.1: What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning censure
pli-tv-pvr5:3.1: of a legal question concerning offences …
pli-tv-pvr5:4.1: of a legal question concerning obligations?
pli-tv-pvr5:5.1: “What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning disputes?”
pli-tv-pvr5:5.2: Greed is a forerunner, hatred is a forerunner, confusion is a forerunner, lack of greed … lack of hatred … lack of confusion is a forerunner.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.4: There are eighteen causal occasions that are matters making for schism.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.6: There are eighteen matters that are matters making for schism.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.8: There are eighteen grounds that are grounds making for schism.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.11: three causes that are skilled, three causes that are unskilled, three causes that are indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.14: “By how many modes does one dispute?”
pli-tv-pvr5:5.16: either the view that it is _Dhamma_ or the view that it is non-_dhamma_.
pli-tv-pvr5:5.17: “By how many decidings is a legal question concerning disputes stopped?”
pli-tv-pvr5:5.18: A legal question concerning disputes is stopped by two decidings:
pli-tv-pvr5:5.19: by a verdict in the presence of and by the decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.1: “What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning censure?”
pli-tv-pvr5:6.4: The four fallings away are causal occasions.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.6: The four fallings away are matters.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.8: The four fallings away are grounds.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.11: three causes that are skilled, three causes that are unskilled three causes that are indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.14: “By how many modes does one censure?”
pli-tv-pvr5:6.16: by the matter or by the offence.
pli-tv-pvr5:6.17: “By how many decidings is a legal question concerning censure stopped?”
pli-tv-pvr5:6.18: A legal question concerning censure is stopped by four decidings:
pli-tv-pvr5:6.19: by a verdict in the presence of and by a verdict of innocence and by a verdict of past insanity and by the decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.1: “What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning offences?”
pli-tv-pvr5:7.4: The seven classes of offence are causal occasions.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.6: The seven classes of offence are matters.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.8: The seven classes of offence are grounds.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.10: Nine causes xkcd: yup, nine, pg 150
pli-tv-pvr5:7.13: The six origins of offences are roots.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.15: By six modes one falls into an offence:
pli-tv-pvr5:7.16: through being shameless, through ignorance, through being scrupulous by nature, through thinking it is allowable when it is not allowable, through thinking it is not allowable when it is allowable, through confusion of mindfulness.
pli-tv-pvr5:7.17: “By how many decidings is a legal question concerning offences stopped?”
pli-tv-pvr5:7.18: … it is stopped by three decidings:
pli-tv-pvr5:7.19: by a verdict in the presence of and by a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement and by a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:8.1: “What is the forerunner of a legal question concerning obligations?”
pli-tv-pvr5:8.13: The Order is the one root.
pli-tv-pvr5:8.15: “By how many modes is an obligation produced?”
pli-tv-pvr5:8.16: An obligation is produced by two modes:
pli-tv-pvr5:8.17: by a motion or by asking for leave.
pli-tv-pvr5:8.18: “By how many decidings is a legal question concerning obligations stopped?”
pli-tv-pvr5:8.19: A legal question concerning obligations is stopped by one decidings:
pli-tv-pvr5:8.20: by a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:9.3: a verdict in the presence of, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, the decision of the majority, the decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:10.1: Might it be that these seven decidings become ten decidings, that ten decidings become seven decidings according to the presentation of the matter?
pli-tv-pvr5:11.2: There are two decidings of a legal question concerning disputes, four decidings of a legal question concerning censure, three decidings of a legal question concerning offences, one deciding of a legal question concerning obligations.
pli-tv-pvr5:11.3: Thus these seven decidings become ten decidings, the ten decidings become seven decidings according to the presentation of the matter.
pli-tv-pvr5:12.1: Concluded is the Sixth Chapter: that on Presentation
pli-tv-pvr5:13.1: How many decidings of a legal question concerning disputes are in common,
pli-tv-pvr5:13.2: how many decidings of a legal question concerning disputes are not in common?
pli-tv-pvr5:13.3: How many decidings of a legal question concerning censure …

pli-tv-pvr5:14.2: a verdict in the presence of, the decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr5:14.3: Five decidings of a legal question concerning disputes are not in common:
pli-tv-pvr5:14.4: a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass.

pli-tv-pvr5:15.2: a verdict in the presence of,
pli-tv-pvr5:15.3: a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr5:15.4: Three decidings of a legal question concerning censure are not in common:
pli-tv-pvr5:15.5: the decision of the majority, the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:16.1: Three decidings of a legal question concerning offences are in common:
pli-tv-pvr5:16.2: a verdict in the presence of, the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:16.3: Four decidings of a legal question concerning offences are not in common:
pli-tv-pvr5:16.4: the decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr5:17.1: One deciding is in common with a legal question concerning obligations:
pli-tv-pvr5:17.2: a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:17.3: Six decidings are not in common with a legal question concerning obligations:
pli-tv-pvr5:17.4: the decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, the carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:18.1: Concluded is the Seventh Chapter: on In Common

pli-tv-pvr5:19.3: How many decidings of a legal question concerning censure …
pli-tv-pvr5:19.5: of a legal question concerning offences …
pli-tv-pvr5:19.8: of a legal question concerning obligations belong to others?

pli-tv-pvr5:20.2: … (as in pli-tv-pvr5:13.0 Prv.5.2.1; _instead of_ in common _and_ not in common _read_ belong to that _and_ belong to others).
pli-tv-pvr5:24.1: Concluded is the Eighth Chapter: on Belongs to That
pli-tv-pvr5:25.1: Are decidings of a deciding in common, are decidings of a deciding not in common?
pli-tv-pvr5:25.2: It may be that decidings of a deciding are in common, it may be that decidings of a deciding are not in common.
pli-tv-pvr5:26.1: How may it be that decidings of a deciding are in common,
pli-tv-pvr5:26.2: how may it be that decidings of a deciding are not in common.
pli-tv-pvr5:26.3: The decision of the majority is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a verdict of innocence, with a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:27.1: A verdict of innocence is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass, a decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr5:28.1: A verdict of past insanity is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass, a decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence.
pli-tv-pvr5:29.1: A carrying out on (his) acknowledgement is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass, a decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity.
pli-tv-pvr5:30.1: A decision for specific depravity is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a covering over (as) with grass, a decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement.
pli-tv-pvr5:31.1: A covering over (as) with grass is in common with a verdict in the presence of; it is not in common with a decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr5:32.1: Thus it may be that decidings are in common with a deciding,
pli-tv-pvr5:32.2: thus it may be that decidings are not in common with a deciding.
pli-tv-pvr5:33.1: Concluded is the Ninth Chapter: on Decidings in common with a Deciding
pli-tv-pvr5:34.1: Do the decidings of a deciding belong to that? Do the decidings of a deciding belong to others?
pli-tv-pvr5:34.2: It may be … (_as in_ Prv.5.4.1 pli-tv-pvr5:25.0; _instead of_ in common _and_ not in common _read_ belong to that _and_ belong to others).
pli-tv-pvr5:42.1: Concluded is the Tenth Chapter: on Do the Decidings of a Deciding belong to That
pli-tv-pvr5:43.1: A deciding is a verdict in the presence of, a verdict in the presence of is a deciding.
pli-tv-pvr5:43.2: A deciding is a decision of the majority, a decision of the majority is a deciding.
pli-tv-pvr5:43.3: A deciding is a verdict of innocence …
pli-tv-pvr5:43.7: is a covering over (as) with grass, a covering over (as) with grass is a deciding.
pli-tv-pvr5:44.1: A decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass—
pli-tv-pvr5:44.2: these decidings are decidings, but not a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:44.3: A verdict in the presence of is a deciding as well as being a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:45.1: A verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity, a covering over (as) with grass, a verdict in the presence of—
pli-tv-pvr5:45.2: these decidings are decidings, but not the decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr5:45.3: A decision of the majority is a deciding as well as being a decision of the majority.
pli-tv-pvr5:50.1: A verdict in the presence of, a decision of the majority, a verdict of innocence, a verdict of past insanity, a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement, a decision for specific depravity—
pli-tv-pvr5:50.2: these decidings are decidings, but not a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:50.3: A covering over (as) with grass is a deciding as well as being a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:51.1: Concluded is the Eleventh Chapter: on A Verdict in the Presence of being a Deciding
pli-tv-pvr5:52.1: A verdict is a verdict in the presence of, a verdict in the presence of is a verdict …
pli-tv-pvr5:52.7: a verdict is a covering over (as) with grass, a covering over (as) with grass is a verdict.
pli-tv-pvr5:53.1: A verdict may be a verdict in the presence of and it may not be a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:53.2: A verdict in the presence of is a verdict as well as being a verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:54.1: A verdict may be a decision of the majority …
pli-tv-pvr5:59.1: a covering over (as) with grass and it may not be a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:59.2: A covering over (as) with grass is a verdict as well as being a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:60.1: Concluded is the Twelfth Chapter: on Verdict

pli-tv-pvr5:62.2: there is no unskilled verdict in the presence of.
pli-tv-pvr5:63.1: The decision of the majority may be skilled, it may be unskilled, it may be indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:68.1: a covering over (as) with grass may be skilled, it may be unskilled, it may be indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:69.1: Is a legal question concerning disputes skilled, unskilled, indeterminate?
pli-tv-pvr5:69.2: Is a legal question concerning censure …

pli-tv-pvr5:71.1: A legal question concerning censure … may be indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:72.1: A legal question concerning offences may be unskilled, it may be indeterminate;
pli-tv-pvr5:72.2: there is no legal question concerning offences that is skilled.
pli-tv-pvr5:73.1: A legal question concerning obligations may be skilled, it may be unskilled, it may be indeterminate.
pli-tv-pvr5:74.1: Concluded is the Thirteenth Chapter: on Skilled
pli-tv-pvr5:75.1: Where a decision of the majority is possible there a verdict in the presence of is possible;
pli-tv-pvr5:75.2: where a verdict in the presence of is possible there a decision of the majority is possible.
pli-tv-pvr5:75.3: Not possible there is a verdict of innocence … a verdict of past insanity … a carrying out on (his) acknowledgement … a decision for specific depravity … a covering over (as) with grass.

pli-tv-pvr5:82.2: where there is a verdict in the presence of there is there a verdict of innocence.

pli-tv-pvr5:83.3: Not there is there a decision of the majority … not there is there a decision for specific depravity.

pli-tv-pvr5:85.1: On that occasion when a legal question is settled by a verdict in the presence of and by a decision of the majority, where a decision of the majority is possible there a verdict in the presence of is possible; where a verdict in the presence of is possible there a decision of the majority is possible.
pli-tv-pvr5:85.2: Not possible there is a verdict of innocence … a covering over (as) with grass.
pli-tv-pvr5:86.1: On that occasion when a legal question is settled by a verdict in the presence of and by a verdict of innocence, where …
pli-tv-pvr5:90.1: On that occasion when a legal question is settled by a verdict in the presence of and by a covering over (as) with grass, where a covering over (as) with grass is possible there a verdict in the presence of is possible; where a verdict in the presence of is possible there a covering over (as) with grass is possible.
pli-tv-pvr5:90.2: Not possible there is a decision of the majority, not possible there is a verdict of innocence … not possible there is a decision for specific depravity.
pli-tv-pvr5:91.1: Concluded is the Fifteenth Chapter: on Occasion
pli-tv-pvr5:92.1: “Legal question” or “deciding”—are these things associated or dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr5:92.2: and is it possible, having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them?
pli-tv-pvr5:93.1: “Legal question” or “deciding”—these things are dissociated, not associated,
pli-tv-pvr5:93.2: and it is possible to point to a difference between them—
pli-tv-pvr5:93.3: this should certainly not be said.
pli-tv-pvr5:93.5: “Legal question” or “deciding”—these things are associated, not dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr5:93.6: and it is not possible, having analysed these things again and again, to point to a difference between them.
pli-tv-pvr5:93.7: What is the reason for this?
pli-tv-pvr5:93.8: Was it not said by the Lord:
pli-tv-pvr5:93.9: “There are, monks, these four legal questions and seven decidings.
pli-tv-pvr5:93.10: Legal questions are settled by decidings; decidings are settled by legal questions.
pli-tv-pvr5:93.11: Thus these things are associated, not dissociated,
pli-tv-pvr5:93.12: and it is not possible … to point to a difference between them.”

pli-tv-pvr5:152.1: Of the four legal questions which legal question originates a legal question concerning disputes?
pli-tv-pvr5:152.2: Of the four legal questions it is not which legal question originates a legal question concerning disputes
pli-tv-pvr5:152.3: yet because of a legal question concerning disputes the four legal questions arise.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.5: As to this monks are disputing, saying,
pli-tv-pvr5:152.6: “It is _Dhamma_” or “It is not _Dhamma_” or “It is Discipline” or “It is not Discipline” or … (_see_ Kd.14.14.2 pli-tv-kd14:14.2.1) …
pli-tv-pvr5:152.7: this is called a legal question concerning disputes.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.8: If the Order disputes about a legal question concerning disputes, there is a legal question concerning disputes.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.9: If one censures when he is disputing, there is a legal question concerning censure.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.10: If one falls into an offence when he is censuring, there is a legal question concerning offences.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.11: If the Order carries out a (formal) act for these offences, there is a legal question concerning obligations.
pli-tv-pvr5:152.12: Thus it is that because of a legal question concerning disputes the four legal questions arise.
